title.narrative: EQUITY-FOCUSED Early Child Development (ECD) & EDUCATION POLICIES

description.narrative: The Ministry of Education, Culture and Science's capacity to develop, budget, design and implement equity-focused, gender-sensitive policies, strategies, norms, requirements for early childhood development, primary and adolescent learning is enhanced., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid), Prevention Of Harmful Practice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged children benefit from increased access and utilization of educational services in a healthy, inclusive and quality learning environment.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Ministry of Education, Culture and Science?s capacity to develop, budget, design and implement equity-focused, gender-sensitivepolicies, strategies, norms, requirements for early childhood development, primary and adolescent learning is enhanced.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued its support in enhancing national policy and regulations to ensure equitable, inclusive, and quality learning environment for both pre-primary and general education. In particular, policy environment to provide better access and learning environment for children with disabilities (CWD) in regular kindergarten and school has been strengthened further. UNICEF’s lead in COVID 19 response including support for school reopening and continuity of learning during school closure as well as support in digital transformation continued to be the key focus in the reporting year. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/01/2022
